trial_identification.studytitle: A Study to Evaluate Ombitasvir/Paritaprevir/Ritonavir and Dasabuvir in Treatment-Na誰ve Hepatitis C Virus Genotype 1b-Infected Adults
trial_identification.scientifictitle: An Open-Label, Single Arm Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Ombitasvir/Paritaprevir/Ritonavir and Dasabuvir in Treatment-Na誰ve Adults With Genotype 1b Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Without Cirrhosis (GARNET)

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Ombitasvir/Paritaprevir/Ritonavir Treatment: drugs - dasabuvir
Experimental: Ombitasvir/Paritaprevir/Ritonavir and Dasabuvir - Ombitasvir/Paritaprevir/Ritonavir(25 mg/150 mg/100 mg once daily) and Dasabuvir (250 mg twice daily) administered for 8 weeks
Treatment: drugs: Ombitasvir/Paritaprevir/Ritonavir Tablet
Treatment: drugs: dasabuvir Tablet

primaryOutcome.outcome: Percentage of participants who achieve sustained virologic response 12 weeks post-treatment (SVR12) - Hepatitis c virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than the lower limit of quantification.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 12 weeks after the last actual dose of study drug

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percentage of participants with virologic failure during treatment - The percentage of participants with confirmed >=1 log10 IU/mL increase from nadir in HCV RNA at any time point during treatment or with confirmed, quantifiable HCV RNA among participants with previous unquantifiable HCV RNA during treatment; or failure to suppress during treatment with at least 6 weeks of treatment.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 8 weeks while on treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percentage of participants with post-treatment relapse - The percentage of participants with confirmed, quantifiable HCV RNA among participants with previous unquantifiable HCV RNA at the end of treatment.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 12 weeks after last dose of study drug

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percentage of female participants who achieve sustained virologic response 12 (SVR12) weeks post-treatment - HCV RNA levels less than the lower limit of quantification
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 12 weeks after the last actual dose of study drug

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percentage of participants with low baseline viral load who achieve sustained virologic response 12 (SVR12) weeks post-treatment - HCV RNA levels less than the lower limit of quantification.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and 12 weeks after the last actual dose of study drug

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
1. Chronic HCV infection at Screening.
2. Screening laboratory result indicating HCV genotype 1b infection.
3. Treatment-na誰ve and non-cirrhotic.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
1. HCV genotype or subtype other than GT1b.
2. Positive test result for Hepatitis B surface antigen (HbsAg) or confirmed positive anti-HIV antibody (HIV Ab) (test).
3. Any current or past clinical evidence of cirrhosis.
4. Screening laboratory analyses that shows abnormal results.
5. Clinically significant abnormalities or co-morbidities, other than HCV infection that make the participant an unsuitable candidate for this study.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of ombitasvir/paritaprevir/ ritonavir and dasabuvir administered for 8 weeks in treatment-na誰ve participants with genotype 1b hepatitis C virus (HCV).
